page.title: 02Attitudes
page.content: Two elderly residents of the village, one for over forty years since coming as a landgirl during World War Two, the other for seventy years, both enjoy the continuing peace of the village but feel that improvements such as better bus services, adequate repairs to pavements and the opening of a public house in Barlow would enhance life considerably. A younger couple who came to the village two years ago because they sought the peace associated with rural life nevertheless are finding it difficult to adjust to fewer facilities than they had been used to in the town where they formerly lived.
